Comment: A short game that starts very quietely, and suddenly goes wild. It shows a somewhat thematic sacrifice from black, with a tense tactic moment. Enjoy.
A different outcome for the Scandivian! White concedes the pawn and developement, but I will have to think.

cx would have kept my pawn to the center. But my style of game will lead me to feel unconfortable without the c pawn to shield any B or N incursion. This option will lead to a very passive game from my part.
Guarding d5 without double-moving the d pawn. The icelandic plan Qe7 - Bc5+ is still possible.
Guarding d5 without double-moving the d pawn. The icelandic plan Qe7 - Bc5+ is still possible.
A waste of time, but white (maybe) remembers some lines in which black plays Ng4...
Allowing the c pawn to move. I play this position with the dsb "out of the box", on b6. But it was not possible with this opening, so maybe I should have gone for cxd6 after all.
Very, very passive for my standards, but hey, I'm playing black!
Very, very passive for my standards, but hey, I'm playing black!
Very slow, but it is a normal - though somewhat passive - way of developement. I am glad I kept the c pawn for c6.
I can't recognize my style of playing! :-)
So simple, so neat.
So simple, so neat.
I'm without a plan! But Ng5 was annoying, I don't want to concede the lsb for a N.
I'm without a plan! But Ng5 was annoying, I don't want to concede the lsb for a N.
Nb6-Qd7 was a line. White would have defended with the usual Kh2, and I would have had the thematic sacrifice Bxh3... that sometimes gets score, sometime doesn't.
I went for this idea: to attack with g5, supporting it with the r. g3 will be my target.
As foreseen, but not really necessary. White should throw in a plan.
I throw in mine, for sure.
A normal developement move, as if on the Kingside nothing will be happening.
h4 can't be played because the N is en prise.
This N can be convenientely exchanged for the Be7 to open up the king's position... but it is not so straight forward, because white still has f4 to interpose.
I don't want HIS Q entering my kingside, or I'll be lost! Due to my risky plan, the game popped out in a tactic and tense battle. Very intense, by now.
Looking for exchanging material, which benefits me since my pieces are cramped.
